00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 <p>
00003         When you launch MiniBatteryLogger, it starts monitoring your laptop battery.
00004         The default view is the chart of the charge and amperage over time. Anyway,
00005         you will have to wait some time to see interesting stuff ;)
00006 </p>
00007 <p class="centered">
00008         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/chartview.png"
00009                 alt="The Chart View" />
00010 </p>
00011 <p>
00012         The chart view shows a graph of the charge of the battery and its amperage 
00013         versus time. Additionally,
00014         a bubble icon will mark each power event: a change of power source, the 
00015         beginning and end of charge, sleep and wakeup.
00016 </p>
00017 <p class="centered">
00018         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/sessionbrowser.png"
00019                 alt="The Sessions Browser" />
00020 </p>
00021 <p>
00022         Monitoring sessions can be saved to disk for later analysis &mdash; by default, automatically.
00023         To manage past sessions, use the Sessions Browser, provided as a drawer.
00024         You can visualize a session just clicking on it, while the application will
00025         continue monitoring the battery in the background.
00026 </p>
00027 <p>
00028         The Battery Inspector shows you all the available details about your battery:
00029         charge, amperage, voltage, capacity &mdash; current and maximum &mdash; time
00030         to empty when on battery power and time to full when charging; number of full
00031         cycles.
00032 </p>
00033 <p class="centered">
00034         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/inspector.png"
00035                 alt="The Battery Inspector" />
00036 </p>
00037 <p>
00038         By default, the application changes its Dock icon to reflect the current
00039         conditions of the battery.
00040         You can also show a battery window on the Desktop if you want to see the
00041         status of the battery 
00042 </p>
00043 <p>
00044         Both icons change their color according to the current amount of charge,
00045         just like <a href="/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/">MiniBatteryStatus widget</a>.
00046 </p>
00047 <p class="centered">
00048         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/desktop_battery_icon.png"
00049                 alt="Desktop battery window" />
00050 </p>
00051 
00052 <h3>Statistics</h3>
00053 <p class="centered">
00054         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/statsview.png"
00055                 alt="The Statistics View" />
00056 </p>
00057 <p>
00058         MiniBatteryLogger keeps a record of your battery health stats. Every time
00059         the cycle count increases or the maximum capacity decreases, MiniBatteryLogger
00060         saves a <strong>&ldquo;snapshot&rdquo;</strong> of your battery, with date and an optional
00061         user comment &mdash; you can also create and delete snapshots manually, of course.
00062 </p>
00063 <p>
00064         Snapshots let you evaluate the evolution of your battery performance along
00065         time, to detect malfunctioning or estimate the remaining battery life.
00066 </p>
00067 
00068 <h3>Comparison</h3>
00069 <p class="centered">
00070         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/compview.png"
00071                 alt="The Comparison View" />
00072 </p>
00073 <p>
00074         By sharing your battery data, you are contributing to the Shared Battery Data
00075         Archive, a project to collect and organize Mac laptop battery data.
00076 </p>
00077 <p>
00078         The Archive makes the <strong>Comparison</strong> feature possible.
00079         Have you ever wondered if your battery is &ldquo;good&rdquo; or compared
00080         to other batteries?
00081         Now with MiniBatteryLogger&rsquo;s comparison tools you can compare your
00082         battery with all other batteries of the same kind in the Archive.
00083 </p>
00084 <p>
00085         The Shared Battery Data Archive is also accessible through a nice
00086         <a href="http://burgos.emeraldion.it/mbl/">web interface</a>.
00087 </p>
00088 
00089 <h3>The Battery Log</h3>
00090 <p class="centered">
00091         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/logview.png"
00092                 alt="The Log View" />
00093 </p>
00094 <p>
00095         MiniBatteryLogger logs to disk all relevant battery and power source events.
00096         The Log View shows the current log from the start of the current session.
00097         Every time an event is caught, a line is appended to the log. A search field
00098         lets you filter the lines of interest (e.g. when you&rsquo;re just searching
00099         for the power chord disconnections, type &ldquo;battery power&rdquo;).
00100 </p>
00101 
00102 
00103 <h3>Preferences</h3>
00104 <p>
00105         Every user has different needs. MiniBatteryLogger lets you customize about
00106         every parameter involved in monitoring the battery and report of data.
00107 </p>
00108 <p class="centered">
00109         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/preferences-general.png"
00110                 alt="General Preferences" />
00111 </p>
00112 <p>
00113         The <strong>General</strong> pane lets you choose the time interval of active
00114         battery polling and to enable or disable the visualization of the battery status
00115         in the application&rsquo;s Dock icon.
00116 </p>
00117 <p class="centered">
00118         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/preferences-chartview.png"
00119                 alt="Chart View Preferences" />
00120 </p>
00121 <p>
00122         The <strong>Chart View</strong> pane lets you choose the colors to be used in
00123         the graph of charge over time.
00124 </p>
00125 
00126 <p class="centered">
00127         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/preferences-notifications.png"
00128                 alt="Notifications Preferences" />
00129 </p>
00130 <p>
00131         From the <strong>Alerts</strong> pane you can customize the way MiniBatteryLogger
00132         warns you about critical events. You can choose the level of charge under which the
00133         application should issue a Low Battery notification, and the level of capacity
00134         under which a Battery Near Death warning should be issued.
00135 </p>
00136 <p class="centered">
00137         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/growl_alert.png"
00138                 alt="Low battery Growl alert" />
00139 </p>
00140 <p>
00141         You can choose to be notified either with Growl alerts
00142         or speech synthesized vocal alerts.
00143 </p>
00144 
00145 <p class="centered">
00146         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/preferences-swupdate.png"
00147                 alt="Software Update Preferences" />
00148 </p>
00149 <p>
00150         The <strong>Software Update</strong> pane lets you enable the automatic update check
00151         at startup. You can also see when the last update check has been performed.
00152         An additional button lets you immediately check if there is an available update.
00153 </p>
00154 
00155 <p class="centered">
00156         <img src="/assets/images/software/macosx/minibatterylogger/preferences-sharing.png"
00157                 alt="Sharing Preferences" />
00158 </p>
00159 <p>
00160         Finally, the <strong>Sharing</strong> pane lets you configure the way
00161         MiniBatteryLogger will interact with the world. From the <strong>Shared Battery Data
00162         Archive settings</strong> box you can set up MiniBatteryLogger to automatically send
00163         your own data to the Archive and retrieve shared data for your computer model.
00164 </p>
00165 <p>
00166         Battery data is sent to the Archive <em>anonymously</em>. No sensible information
00167         will be ever sent without your consent.
00168 </p>
00169 <p>
00170         From the <strong>Data Sharing settings</strong> box you can also
00171         set up MiniBatteryLogger
00172         to look for shared batteries and to share your own data over the network.
00173 </p>
00174 <p>
00175         You may also decide not to advertise the service with Bonjour or to require a 
00176         password to access your data (currently not implemented).
00177 </p>
Generated on Wed Oct 7 19:26:49 2015 for Emeraldion Lodge (codename Zelda) by  1.5.8
